citation.article-title: Sphingomonas aquatilis sp. nov., Sphingomonas koreensis sp. nov., and Sphingomonas taejonensis sp. nov., yellow-pigmented bacteria isolated from natural mineral water.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Sphingomonas koreensis sp. nov.
Sphingomonas koreensis (ko.re.en'sis. N.L. f. adj. koreensis of Korea, from where the new organisms were isolated)
Cells are Gram-negative, motile rods with single polar flagella.
Colonies are circular, entire, low-convex, smooth, opaque and yellow.
Indole, urease and arginine dihydrolase are not produced.
Catalase, oxidase and β-galactosidase are positive.
Gelatin is not liquified and glucose is not fermented.
Reduction of nitrate and hydrolysis of aesculin are negative.

D-Melibiose, D-sucrose, glucose, malate, maltose, N-acetylglucosamine, rhamnose and salicin are assimilated; 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, adipate, caprate, citrate, D-ribose, D-sorbitol, gluconate, glycogen, L-arabinose, mannose and phenylacetate are not assimilated.
Acid is weakly produced oxidatively from glucose and rhamnose, but not from glycerol.
The G+­C content of the DNA is 66 mol%.
The major isoprenoid quinone is ubiquinone Q-10.
The major non-polar fatty acids are 18:1ω7c and 16:0; the major 2-hydroxy fatty acids are 14:0 2-OH, 15:0 2-OH and 16:0 2-OH.
Strains were isolated from natural mineral water from Taejon City, Korea.
The type strain is JSS26T (=KCTC 2882T=KCCM 41069T) and JSS28 (=KCTC 2883=KCCM 41066) is a reference strain.
